The actual problem I'm seeing is that in the following code:

import torch

x = torch.randn(3, 3)

def fn(x):
    return x[[0, 1], [1, 0]]

traced = torch.jit.trace(fn, x)
traced(x)
traced.graph_for(x)

graph(%0 : Float(*, *)) {
  %17 : Dynamic[] = prim::Constant[value=[<Tensors>]]()
  %12 : Dynamic = aten::index(%0, %17)
  return (%12);
}

Each "Tensor" in the prim::Constant has type DynamicType and so %17 has requires_grad=True, which causes a crash in autodiff if I allow single-node differential subgraphs (so only the prim::Constant is in the differential subgraph)

body:
The actual problem I'm seeing is that in the following code:
```
import torch

x = torch.randn(3, 3)

def fn(x):
    return x[[0, 1], [1, 0]]

traced = torch.jit.trace(fn, x)
traced(x)
traced.graph_for(x)

graph(%0 : Float(*, *)) {
  %17 : Dynamic[] = prim::Constant[value=[<Tensors>]]()
  %12 : Dynamic = aten::index(%0, %17)
  return (%12);
}
```
Each "Tensor" in the prim::Constant has type DynamicType and so `%17` has requires_grad=True, which causes a crash in autodiff if I allow single-node differential subgraphs (so only the prim::Constant is in the differential subgraph)
